channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The graffiti on the fence, 26th July
item.description:
After driving through the A2 I noticed several graffiti signs on the fence, by Kidbrook Village. The whole of the A2 is littered with graffiti and it looks awful. Like a third world country and this should be cleared up. If you drive from Danson Park to the o2 please look at how much graffiti there is and looks disgusting. Please find a team to clear this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Way Relief Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown Cladophora in Canal, 26th July
item.description:
The overgrown Cladophora should be removed or reduce. Excessive growth is a red flag for nutrient pollution and ecosystem imbalance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redbourne Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes, 26th July
item.description:
Numerous potholes need to be repaired. The council before decided to repair just one pot hole and it was awful. There must be around 10 large holes that need filling
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 124, Ramillies Road, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No right turn at junction of Alleyn Park and Paxton Green roundabout has been hit or turned so that it is no longer visible to motorists approaching the roundabout. Motorists are turning right into South Croxted Road, 26th July
item.description:
Motorists turning right into South Croxted Road are potentially causing a dangerous situation especially for pedestrians. There is no damage to the sign, it just needs to be repositioned on the existing pole. Suggest urgent action before an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baird Gardens, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Constant illegal parking, 26th July
item.description:
Constant illegal parking here, also reported by other people previously. Maybe time to use law enforcement ? That would help tackle the speeding drivers which scare local residents too. Anyone not in a car is in danger on Whiston Road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally parked car, 26th July
item.description:

item.title: Constant Dangerous driving, 26th July
item.description:
Depite being a 20mph zone, delivery trucks and vans drive at 40/50mph constantly, scaring the locals. This is a HIGHLY residential zone (nothing but houses and apartments), with schools and kids around. Put Zebra crossings or officers !

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Laburnum Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass in childrens playground, 26th July
item.description:
Someone has smashed a glass bottle in the children's playground, some has gone under the slide, most is in a pile but shards are scattered around. This is hazardous for the children.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Village Way, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cabinet and office chair fly tipped on Mead Way, 26th July
item.description:
Was put there by a local resident at approx. 7.10 pm Saturday 26 July 2025. Details of household it came from available.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mead Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Problem Neighbours Always Have Lime Bikes Outside, 26th July
item.description:
Problem neighbours at Number 5 Follingham Court always have Lime Bikes outside their property. Also have various dodgy looking characters visiting their property. We can all see what’s happening here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drysdale Place, Shoreditch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgusting Area Behind Flats & Dogs Fouling, 26th July
item.description:
Honestly this is becoming a bit of a joke now. How many times do people on this estate need to complain about this. Someone complained on the 18th on here and it’s still not clean and you’re not doing anything about the residents causing it. Ridiculous.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Drysdale Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
